nodes.documentation:
@title Liquid staking pool implementation
* Lido is an Ethereum 2.0 liquid staking protocol solving the problem of frozen staked Ethers
until transfers become available in Ethereum 2.0.
Whitepaper: https://lido.fi/static/Lido:Ethereum-Liquid-Staking.pdf
* NOTE: the code below assumes moderate amount of node operators, e.g. up to 50.
* Since balances of all token holders change when the amount of total pooled Ether
changes, this token cannot fully implement ERC20 standard: it only emits `Transfer`
events upon explicit transfer between holders. In contrast, when Lido oracle reports
rewards, no Transfer events are generated: doing so would require emitting an event
for each token holder and thus running an unbounded loop.
nodes.name: Lido

nodes.documentation: @return the name of the token.

@notice Moves `_amount` tokens from the caller's account to the `_recipient` account.
     * @return a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
Emits a `Transfer` event.
     * Requirements:
     * - `_recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- the caller must have a balance of at least `_amount`.
- the contract must not be paused.
     * @dev The `_amount` argument is the amount of tokens, not shares.
nodes.name: transfer

nodes.documentation:
@notice Sets `_amount` as the allowance of `_spender` over the caller's tokens.
     * @return a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
Emits an `Approval` event.
     * Requirements:
     * - `_spender` cannot be the zero address.
- the contract must not be paused.
     * @dev The `_amount` argument is the amount of tokens, not shares.
nodes.name: approve

nodes.documentation:
@notice Moves `_amount` tokens from `_sender` to `_recipient` using the
allowance mechanism. `_amount` is then deducted from the caller's
allowance.
     * @return a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
     * Emits a `Transfer` event.
Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.
     * Requirements:
     * - `_sender` and `_recipient` cannot be the zero addresses.
- `_sender` must have a balance of at least `_amount`.
- the caller must have allowance for `_sender`'s tokens of at least `_amount`.
- the contract must not be paused.
     * @dev The `_amount` argument is the amount of tokens, not shares.
nodes.name: transferFrom

nodes.documentation:
@notice Atomically increases the allowance granted to `_spender` by the caller by `_addedValue`.
     * This is an alternative to `approve` that can be used as a mitigation for
problems described in:
https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol#L42
Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.
     * Requirements:
     * - `_spender` cannot be the the zero address.
- the contract must not be paused.
nodes.name: increaseAllowance

nodes.documentation:
@notice Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `_spender` by the caller by `_subtractedValue`.

https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol#L42
Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.
     * Requirements:
     * - `_spender` cannot be the zero address.
- `_spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `_subtractedValue`.
- the contract must not be paused.

nodes.documentation:
@title Interest-bearing ERC20-like token for Lido Liquid Stacking protocol.
 * This contract is abstract. To make the contract deployable override the
`_getTotalPooledEther` function. `Lido.sol` contract inherits StETH and defines
the `_getTotalPooledEther` function.
 * StETH balances are dynamic and represent the holder's share in the total amount
of Ether controlled by the protocol. Account shares aren't normalized, so the
contract also stores the sum of all shares to calculate each account's token balance
which equals to:
 *   shares[account] * _getTotalPooledEther() / _getTotalShares()
 * For example, assume that we have:
 *   _getTotalPooledEther() -> 10 ETH
  sharesOf(user1) -> 100
  sharesOf(user2) -> 400
 * Therefore:
 *   balanceOf(user1) -> 2 tokens which corresponds 2 ETH
  balanceOf(user2) -> 8 tokens which corresponds 8 ETH
 * Since balances of all token holders change when the amount of total pooled Ether
changes, this token cannot fully implement ERC20 standard: it only emits `Transfer`
events upon explicit transfer between holders. In contrast, when total amount of
pooled Ether increases, no `Transfer` events are generated: doing so would require
emitting an event for each token holder and thus running an unbounded loop.
 * The token inherits from `Pausable` and uses `whenNotStopped` modifier for methods
which change `shares` or `allowances`. `_stop` and `_resume` functions are overriden
in `Lido.sol` and might be called by an account with the `PAUSE_ROLE` assigned by the
DAO. This is useful for emergency scenarios, e.g. a protocol bug, where one might want
to freeze all token transfers and approvals until the emergency is resolved.
nodes.name: StETH

nodes.documentation:
@title Liquid staking pool
  * For the high-level description of the pool operation please refer to the paper.
Pool manages withdrawal keys and fees. It receives ether submitted by users on the ETH 1 side
and stakes it via the deposit_contract.sol contract. It doesn't hold ether on it's balance,
only a small portion (buffer) of it.
It also mints new tokens for rewards generated at the ETH 2.0 side.
nodes.name: ILido

transferToVault(address).notice: Send funds to recovery Vault. This contract should never receive funds,        but in case it does, this function allows one to recover them.

allowRecoverability(address).details: By default deriving from AragonApp makes it recoverable

params.token: Token address that would be recovered

params._token: Token balance to be sent to recovery vault.

approve(address,uint256).notice: Sets `_amount` as the allowance of `_spender` over the caller's tokens.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `_spender` by the caller by `_subtractedValue`.     * This is an alternative to `approve` that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in: https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol#L42 Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `_spender` cannot be the zero address. - `_spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `_subtractedValue`. - the contract must not be paused.

depositBufferedEther().notice: Deposits buffered ethers to the official DepositContract.

depositBufferedEther(uint256).notice: Deposits buffered ethers to the official DepositContract, making no more than `_maxDeposits` deposit calls.

getBeaconStat().notice: Returns the key values related to Beacon-side

getBufferedEther().notice: Get the amount of Ether temporary buffered on this contract balance

getOperators().notice: Gets node operators registry interface handle

getWithdrawalCredentials().notice: Returns current credentials to withdraw ETH on ETH 2.0 side after the phase 2 is launched

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `_spender` by the caller by `_addedValue`.     * This is an alternative to `approve` that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in: https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol#L42 Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `_spender` cannot be the the zero address. - the contract must not be paused.

pushBeacon(uint256,uint256).notice: Updates the number of Lido-controlled keys in the beacon validators set and their total balance.

setFee(uint16).notice: Set fee rate to `_feeBasisPoints` basis points. The fees are accrued when oracles report staking results

setFeeDistribution(uint16,uint16,uint16).notice: Set fee distribution: `_treasuryFeeBasisPoints` basis points go to the treasury, `_insuranceFeeBasisPoints` basis points go to the insurance fund, `_operatorsFeeBasisPoints` basis points go to node operators. The sum has to be 10 000.

setOracle(address).notice: Set authorized oracle contract address to `_oracle`

setWithdrawalCredentials(bytes32).notice: Set credentials to withdraw ETH on ETH 2.0 side after the phase 2 is launched to `_withdrawalCredentials`

submit(address).notice: Send funds to the pool with optional _referral parameter

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Moves `_amount` tokens from the caller's account to the `_recipient` account.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Moves `_amount` tokens from `_sender` to `_recipient` using the allowance mechanism. `_amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance.

transferToVault(address).notice: Send funds to recovery Vault. Overrides default AragonApp behaviour.

allowRecoverability(address).details: By default deriving from AragonApp makes it recoverable

params.token: Token address that would be recovered

allowance(address,address).details: This value changes when `approve` or `transferFrom` is called.

approve(address,uint256).details: The `_amount` argument is the amount of tokens, not shares.

balanceOf(address).details: Balances are dynamic and equal the `_account`'s share in the amount of the total Ether controlled by the protocol. See `sharesOf`.

canPerform(address,bytes32,uint256[]).details: Check whether an action can be performed by a sender for a particular role on this app

depositBufferedEther().details: This function is separated from submit() to reduce the cost of sending funds.

depositBufferedEther(uint256).details: This function is separated from submit() to reduce the cost of sending funds.

getBufferedEther().details: Buffered balance is kept on the contract from the moment the funds are received from user until the moment they are actually sent to the official Deposit contract.

getRecoveryVault().details: Get the recovery vault for the app

getTotalPooledEther().details: The sum of all ETH balances in the protocol, equals to the total supply of stETH.

getTotalShares().details: The sum of all accounts' shares can be an arbitrary number, therefore it is necessary to store it in order to calculate each account's relative share.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: As AragonApp, Lido contract must be initialized with following variables:

pushBeacon(uint256,uint256).details: periodically called by the Oracle contract

params._beaconBalance: simmarized balance of Lido-controlled keys in wei
params._beaconValidators: number of Lido's keys in the beacon state

setInsuranceFund(address).details: Contract specified here is used to accumulate the protocol insurance fee.

setOracle(address).details: Contract specified here is allowed to make periodical updates of beacon states by calling pushBeacon.

setTreasury(address).details: Contract specified here is used to accumulate the protocol treasury fee.

setWithdrawalCredentials(bytes32).details: Note that setWithdrawalCredentials discards all unused signing keys as the signatures are invalidated.

params._withdrawalCredentials: hash of withdrawal multisignature key as accepted by       the deposit_contract.deposit function

submit(address).details: This function is alternative way to submit funds. Supports optional referral address.

totalSupply().details: Always equals to `_getTotalPooledEther()` since token amount is pegged to the total amount of Ether controlled by the protocol.

transfer(address,uint256).details: The `_amount` argument is the amount of tokens, not shares.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: The `_amount` argument is the amount of tokens, not shares.

params._token: Token to be sent to recovery vault.

devdoc.title: Liquid staking pool implementation * Lido is an Ethereum 2.0 liquid staking protocol solving the problem of frozen staked Ethers until transfers become available in Ethereum 2.0. Whitepaper: https://lido.fi/static/Lido:Ethereum-Liquid-Staking.pdf * NOTE: the code below assumes moderate amount of node operators, e.g. up to 50. * Since balances of all token holders change when the amount of total pooled Ether changes, this token cannot fully implement ERC20 standard: it only emits `Transfer` events upon explicit transfer between holders. In contrast, when Lido oracle reports rewards, no Transfer events are generated: doing so would require emitting an event for each token holder and thus running an unbounded loop.

approve(address,uint256).notice: Sets `_amount` as the allowance of `_spender` over the caller's tokens.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `_spender` by the caller by `_subtractedValue`.     * This is an alternative to `approve` that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in: https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol#L42 Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `_spender` cannot be the zero address. - `_spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `_subtractedValue`. - the contract must not be paused.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `_spender` by the caller by `_addedValue`.     * This is an alternative to `approve` that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in: https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol#L42 Emits an `Approval` event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `_spender` cannot be the the zero address. - the contract must not be paused.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Moves `_amount` tokens from the caller's account to the `_recipient` account.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Moves `_amount` tokens from `_sender` to `_recipient` using the allowance mechanism. `_amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance.

allowance(address,address).details: This value changes when `approve` or `transferFrom` is called.

approve(address,uint256).details: The `_amount` argument is the amount of tokens, not shares.

balanceOf(address).details: Balances are dynamic and equal the `_account`'s share in the amount of the total Ether controlled by the protocol. See `sharesOf`.

getTotalPooledEther().details: The sum of all ETH balances in the protocol, equals to the total supply of stETH.

getTotalShares().details: The sum of all accounts' shares can be an arbitrary number, therefore it is necessary to store it in order to calculate each account's relative share.

totalSupply().details: Always equals to `_getTotalPooledEther()` since token amount is pegged to the total amount of Ether controlled by the protocol.

transfer(address,uint256).details: The `_amount` argument is the amount of tokens, not shares.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: The `_amount` argument is the amount of tokens, not shares.

devdoc.title: Interest-bearing ERC20-like token for Lido Liquid Stacking protocol. * This contract is abstract. To make the contract deployable override the `_getTotalPooledEther` function. `Lido.sol` contract inherits StETH and defines the `_getTotalPooledEther` function. * StETH balances are dynamic and represent the holder's share in the total amount of Ether controlled by the protocol. Account shares aren't normalized, so the contract also stores the sum of all shares to calculate each account's token balance which equals to: *   shares[account] * _getTotalPooledEther() / _getTotalShares() * For example, assume that we have: *   _getTotalPooledEther() -> 10 ETH  sharesOf(user1) -> 100  sharesOf(user2) -> 400 * Therefore: *   balanceOf(user1) -> 2 tokens which corresponds 2 ETH  balanceOf(user2) -> 8 tokens which corresponds 8 ETH * Since balances of all token holders change when the amount of total pooled Ether changes, this token cannot fully implement ERC20 standard: it only emits `Transfer` events upon explicit transfer between holders. In contrast, when total amount of pooled Ether increases, no `Transfer` events are generated: doing so would require emitting an event for each token holder and thus running an unbounded loop. * The token inherits from `Pausable` and uses `whenNotStopped` modifier for methods which change `shares` or `allowances`. `_stop` and `_resume` functions are overriden in `Lido.sol` and might be called by an account with the `PAUSE_ROLE` assigned by the DAO. This is useful for emergency scenarios, e.g. a protocol bug, where one might want to freeze all token transfers and approvals until the emergency is resolved.

deposit(bytes,bytes,bytes,bytes32).notice: Top-ups deposit of a validator on the ETH 2.0 side

params.deposit_data_root: The deposits Merkle tree node, used as a checksum
params.withdrawal_credentials: Credentials that allows to withdraw funds

getBeaconStat().notice: Returns the key values related to Beacon-side

getBufferedEther().notice: Gets the amount of Ether temporary buffered on this contract balance

getTotalPooledEther().notice: Gets the amount of Ether controlled by the system

getWithdrawalCredentials().notice: Returns current credentials to withdraw ETH on ETH 2.0 side after the phase 2 is launched

pushBeacon(uint256,uint256).notice: Ether on the ETH 2.0 side reported by the oracle

setFee(uint16).notice: Set fee rate to `_feeBasisPoints` basis points. The fees are accrued when oracles report staking results

setFeeDistribution(uint16,uint16,uint16).notice: Set fee distribution: `_treasuryFeeBasisPoints` basis points go to the treasury, `_insuranceFeeBasisPoints` basis points go to the insurance fund, `_operatorsFeeBasisPoints` basis points go to node operators. The sum has to be 10 000.

setWithdrawalCredentials(bytes32).notice: Set credentials to withdraw ETH on ETH 2.0 side after the phase 2 is launched to `_withdrawalCredentials`

withdraw(uint256,bytes32).notice: Issues withdrawal request. Large withdrawals will be processed only after the phase 2 launch.

params._eth2balance: Balance in wei on the ETH 2.0 side

setWithdrawalCredentials(bytes32).details: Note that setWithdrawalCredentials discards all unused signing keys as the signatures are invalidated.

params._withdrawalCredentials: hash of withdrawal multisignature key as accepted by       the deposit_contract.deposit function

devdoc.title: Liquid staking pool  * For the high-level description of the pool operation please refer to the paper. Pool manages withdrawal keys and fees. It receives ether submitted by users on the ETH 1 side and stakes it via the deposit_contract.sol contract. It doesn't hold ether on it's balance, only a small portion (buffer) of it. It also mints new tokens for rewards generated at the ETH 2.0 side.

addNodeOperator(string,address,uint64).notice: Add node operator named `name` with reward address `rewardAddress` and staking limit `stakingLimit` validators

addSigningKeys(uint256,uint256,bytes,byt.notice: Add `_quantity` validator signing keys to the keys of the node operator #`_operator_id`. Concatenated keys are: `_pubkeys`

assignNextSigningKeys(uint256).notice: Selects and returns at most `_numKeys` signing keys (as well as the corresponding        signatures) from the set of active keys and marks the selected keys as used.        May only be called by the pool contract.

getActiveNodeOperatorsCount().notice: Returns number of active node operators

getNodeOperatorsCount().notice: Returns total number of node operators

getRewardsDistribution(uint256).notice: Returns the rewards distribution proportional to the effective stake for each node operator.

getSigningKey(uint256,uint256).notice: Returns n-th signing key of the node operator #`_operator_id`

getTotalSigningKeyCount(uint256).notice: Returns total number of signing keys of the node operator #`_operator_id`

getUnusedSigningKeyCount(uint256).notice: Returns number of usable signing keys of the node operator #`_operator_id`

removeSigningKey(uint256,uint256).notice: Removes a validator signing key #`_index` from the keys of the node operator #`_operator_id`

reportStoppedValidators(uint256,uint64).notice: Report `_stoppedIncrement` more stopped validators of the node operator #`_id`

setNodeOperatorName(uint256,string).notice: Change human-readable name of the node operator #`_id` to `_name`

setNodeOperatorRewardAddress(uint256,add.notice: Change reward address of the node operator #`_id` to `_rewardAddress`

setNodeOperatorStakingLimit(uint256,uint.notice: Set the maximum number of validators to stake for the node operator #`_id` to `_stakingLimit`

params._rewardAddress: Ethereum 1 address which receives stETH rewards for this operator
params._stakingLimit: the maximum number of validators to stake for this operator

addSigningKeys(uint256,uint256,bytes,byt.details: Along with each key the DAO has to provide a signatures for the     (pubkey, withdrawal_credentials, 32000000000) message.     Given that information, the contract'll be able to call     deposit_contract.deposit on-chain.

params._signatures: Several concatenated signatures for (pubkey, withdrawal_credentials, 32000000000) messages

params._numKeys: The number of keys to select. The actual number of selected keys may be less       due to the lack of active keys.

params._fullInfo: If true, name will be returned as well

params._totalRewardShares: Total amount of reward shares to distribute.

params._index: Index of the key, starting with 0
Index of the key, starting with 0

trimUnusedKeys().details: Function is used by the pool

devdoc.title: Node Operator registry  * Node Operator registry manages signing keys and other node operator data. It's also responsible for distributing rewards to node operators.
